file_content.text: Transport to Darvannis is prepared. Good luck.
Good day.
Chancellor?
Welcome back! You never cease to amaze--every last one of the mercenaries defeated, even with the Dread Masters themselves intervening.
The thought of those butchers going to work for the Hutts was bad enough... if the Dread Masters had taken control of them, I can't imagine the carnage we'd face.
We can hardly make a move without the Dread Masters going against us.
The masters' reach is growing.
You're right--and we're not going to stand for it any longer.
How did you know the Dread Masters were involved?
You heard what happened?
Our mutual friends kept me updated as your mission progressed. I only wish we could've sent help.
No more waiting--we're going to end this threat once and for all.
It was all a little too convenient. I think we were set up.
This was all very suspicious.
No--the GenoHaradan are absolutely loyal, and we'll need every ally we can get to end the real threat.
All the Republic's resources--military, SIS, even the GenoHaradan--will be dedicated to finding the Dread Masters' hiding place. Once we do, you will neutralize them.
We can't let them spread their dark influence any further--that much is certain.
If that's what it takes.
And if we can capture them alive, instead?
Neutralize?
That Republic forces managed to capture them once was miraculous. I doubt we'll have that option again.
Havoc Squad is always ready to serve, Chancellor.
Understood.
I do love being in demand.
Anytime, anywhere.
Won't that give the Empire free reign? There's no telling what they could do with no one watching.
What about the war?
Our resources aren't infinite. We must hope to deal with the Dread Masters quickly enough that the Empire doesn't gain the upper hand.
The Dread Masters aren't going to wait around. They'll move again--very soon.
Make it fast.
When I say every resource, I mean it.
For now, you should rest--you're going to need your strength. Hopefully, very soon.
Good luck on your mission.
Right this way.
Chancellor?
Thank you, Major. That will be all.
Let's not waste time with formalities. A... reliable intelligence source has discovered something very interesting on the planet Darvannis: The Hutts are still plotting against us.
If the Jedi can help dismantle the Hutts' plans, we'll gladly do so.
How can I help?
The Republic is fortunate to have such reliable allies.
The Sith do much more than just plot. What makes this a priority?
Why so urgent?
We can hold our own against one enemy. Two are more than I want to deal with.
If we have to strike at the Hutts again, we'll strike at them again. Whatever it takes.
Then we'll respond.
I'm glad we're in agreement.
The Cartel aren't exactly gracious losers.
Typical.
How can the Hutts be making plans? Have they found a new leader?
But their leader is dead!
Karagga's death was a major stumbling block, but the Hutts aren't finished yet.
Who uncovered these Hutt plans, exactly?
A reliable source?
Before I say more, let me be clear: Anything seen or discussed in this room is classified. Our intelligence source is a closely guarded state secret.
We are GenoHaradan.
The GenoHaradan order operates... independently of ordinary Republic channels. They're the ones who uncovered the Hutt Cartel's secret plans.
What exactly are the Cartel's plans?
These plans being...?
What exactly is this "GenoHaradan order"?
GenoHaradan?
The bright light of the Republic casts many shadows. We live within them, neutralizing what threats we can and illuminating those we can't.
Is it wise to put our faith in these people?
Outsiders can't be trusted.
It's great to see the Republic reaching out to more outside contractors.
They're just like me!
Our dedication to the Republic is centuries-old.
The Hutts have enticed the galaxy's most brutal mercenary armies to an arms bazaar and show of strength on Darvannis.
Lucrative contracts will go to whichever mercenaries bring the most impressive and deadly displays. Commerce, spectacle and recruitment, all in one.
A party, celebrating violence and greed.
Sounds horrible.
Such is the way of the uncivilized.
If we observe who the Hutts decide to recruit, we could determine exactly what they have in mind.
We should see who gets hired.
I want you to do more than observe.
If they're all in one place, we can take them down in a single strike.
We can hit them all at once.
If the Hutts want a spectacle, I say we give 'em one!
Let's crash the party!
My thoughts exactly.
Just how many mercenaries are we talking about?
How big will the gathering be?
Attendance will be high--the Hutts are offering very large contracts, and none of these groups will wish to appear smaller than the others.
Storming into a mess like that sounds like a perfect way to get killed. How do we know that isn't your plan?
Maybe you're setting us up.
We can rely on the GenoHaradan--they've proven their loyalty more times than I can count.
Darvannis cannot be approached unseen by any large military force. We recommend a smaller strike team--led by you.
These mercenaries are the most bloodthirsty in the galaxy--their atrocities rival the worst of the Sith. They cannot be allowed to join the Hutt Cartel.
The Hutts won't get any new allies on our watch, Chancellor.
We won't let that happen.
We are certain of it.
This incredibly risky assault won't be going unrewarded, will it?
How much is it worth to you?
Of course not.
The Supreme Chancellor is quite generous where the Republic's security is concerned.
If this turns out to be an ambush... you'd better hope it works.
I'll be watching for traps.
We hope only for the eternal prosperity of the Republic.
A ship has already been prepared to take you to Darvannis. I'm counting on you.
Good luck.
Stand back, please.
